title: [BEAM-11249] Read larger chunks for dataframe sources.
body:
A typical csv might have 10-1k bytes per line; the chunksize of 100 would result in kb-sized chunks. Bumping this up brings us into the mb-sized range. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-8889] Upgrade GCSIO to 2.1.6
body:
This is required to address null-pointer issue happening with 2.1.5 of gcsio. GCSIO 2.1.6 has a [fix](https://github.com/GoogleCloudDataproc/hadoop-connectors/pull/486). R: @kennknowles ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-10891] Standardized developer build environment using Docker
body:
This adds a docker based build environment intended for developers to have a predictable working environment with all needed tools present. On a Linux machine (I ONLY tested this on my Ubuntu 20.04 laptop) just run the `start-build-env.sh` script to build and start a Docker based build setup that wraps around the current source tree beam copy. This is based upon the initiative started by @omarismail94 #12837 and copies large parts from https://github.com/apache/hadoop As suggested by @TheNeuralBit in #12837 I was able to run `./gradlew :sdks:python:container:py37:docker` inside this docker setup which actually created a 2.39GB docker image `apache/beam_python3.7_sdk:2.27.0.dev` TODO: - [ ] Check if the entire build works in this. - [x] Write the documentation. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11196] Ensure parent of fused stages is not one of its transforms
body:
#13202 introduces a bug where the algorithm that determines the parents of fused stage can create loops, because the lowest common ancestor algorithm considers a transform to be its own parent. Fusing a single transform A will result cause the fused stage's parent to be set to A. Fusing a transform A with a descendant B will also cause fused stage's parent to be set to A. To fix this, if the parent of the fused stage would be one of transforms to be fused, set the parent to the parent of that transform instead. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11214] Exclude more KuduIO from checker since it crashes under Java 11

Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-11226] Increase the deadline for CreateReadSession to 2 hours
body:
This change increases the client-side deadline for calls to [CreateReadSession](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/storage#create_a_session) from the default value of 10 minutes to 2 hours in order to match the maximum duration of an initial split operation in Dataflow for a bounded source. This allows larger BigQuery tables to be processed by Dataflow pipelines, even if the start time may be non-trivial. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11216] Fix ReaderCache to not resume from a cached reader for w
body:
ork item retries. Such retries can occur particularly in autoscaling with Streaming Engine enabled when the original commit for the work item is sent to the wrong backend and is dropped. Then the retry would have the same cache token but would incorrectly resume from where the reader last stopped instead of the checkpoint within the request. **Please** add a meaningful description for your change here ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11074] Adjust release candidate email template to encourage reviewers.
body:
Hopefully adding a line to establish expectations will mean more people are willing to vote. I wasn't sure how to word it in a formal way, but the intent I was going for is: "if your own use case works, that's enough to leave +1". The point here is to counter overly high expectations, like that +1s are only worth leaving if everything is confirmed to work, or that you need to personally test the release to leave a +1 (if someone else tested your use case and it works, that should be enough). ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11074] build_release_candidate usability improvements.
body:
Specifically, this change checks whether a tag exists before calling the gradle release plugin, allowing the user to either delete the existing tag or skip creating the tag. Also avoids going into interactive commit messages with SVN, instead using commit messages built-in to the script. Note that the original intention behind this change is to allow finer-grained skipping in the release candidate script to avoid problems if steps need to be repeated if a release candidate fails. For example, in the current implementation if a release candidate fails after creating a release candidate tag and that step gets run again, it'll cause an error due to trying to create an existing tag. I tried to read through the script to find other instances where repeating a step might be problematic, but I couldn't really find anything else that isn't already skippable. Reviewers, let me know if I missed any. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Add side input test verifies runner test where side input never becomes ready

title: [BEAM-11172] Enable KafkaIO performance test for Dataflow runner v2 with SDF.
body:
Current KafkaIO Performance test runs in batch mode on Dataflow java production worker. This PR adds 2 more test target into this performance suite: - KafkaIO runs on Dataflow runner v2 with SDF unbounded wrapper - Kafka read SDF implementation runs on Dataflow runner v2. r: @aromanenko-dev r: @tysonjh Could you please help review changes related to google-could-dataflow? cc: @kennknowles ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-11159] listSubscriptions should remove TestPubsub's own sub
body:
listSubscriptions used to remove the subscription that TestPubsub itself created, but I didn't port over this logic in https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/13273. This is very likely the cause of the SQL PostCommit failures. The test is supposed to wait until the pipeline under test has created a subscription before moving on and publishing test data, but it is proceeding early because it's counting the subscription created by TestPubsub. title: [BEAM-11200] Update useragent version of Go SDK
body:
Specifically when sent to dataflow. Note this doesn't yet mean the SDK is out of experimental yet, or that Dataflow supports use of the SDK, which is outside the control of Apache Beam contributors. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10921] Add the UserPipelineTracker to track user pipelines for derived pipelines
body:
This code is a data structure to track which derived pipelines came from which user pipelines. Previous code to calculate this relationship erroneously used pipeline-specific PCollection ids. This makes the relationship explicit. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11159] Use GCP pubsub client for TestPubsub
body:
The official GCP client has better tuned timeouts and retry configs for this application, using it should reduce flakiness. title: [BEAM-11207] Metric Extraction via proto RPC API
body:
This PR is an implementation of the following proposal: https://s.apache.org/get-metrics-api. The ultimate goal is to offer a way to query user metrics after a job. The API follows the design of existing APIs in Python and Java SDKs. How it works from user's perspective: ```go result, _ := beamx.RunPipelineWithMetrics(ctx, p) queryResult := result.Metrics().Query() fmt.Println(queryResult.GetCounters()) fmt.Println(queryResult.GetDistributions()) fmt.Println(queryResult.GetGauges()) ``` An example of output: ``` [{1 1 {fn/read/n2/SplitAndSize0:0 }} {20000 20000 {main.counterOperationFn counter-0 counterOperationFn}} {1 1 {fn/read/n1:0 }}] [] [] ``` ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-3736] Disable CombineFnVisitor
body:
CombineFnVisitor is not working properly and triggers an exception for correct pipelines. It should be disabled until being fixed. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9547] Add basic support for `DataFrame.{eval,query}`
body:
Adds support for executing `eval` and `query` as element-wise methods. Restricts most kwargs to their defaults for simplicity, only parser, engine and truediv are still allowed to be changed. This PR also includes a commit to pass `*args` through `maybe_inplace` as not having it breaks `eval`. title: [BEAM-10556] Move rawtype error suppression to class level
body:
Previously rawtype errors were suppressed at the module level. This makes it more fine-grained so it is easier to fix a class and have it stay fixed. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-11192] Replace Java FnApi test tasks with Runner V2.
body:
The FnApi tests are no longer needed since the JRH is exercised through Python xlang portability tests. The configuration can be repurposed for runner v2 testing. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-11188] Add wrappers to Go Xlang examples, and adjust front-end.
body:
Adds wrappers around each test xlang transform used in the examples, which show how xlang transforms are best implemented. Also adjusts the xlang fronte-end, specifically removing the misleadingly named Sink and Source versions of the methods, and adjusting the Input/Output tag naming to match and adding some helpers. Note: Currently the CoGroupByKey, Partition, and MultiInputOutput examples are failing when run manually, however that seems unrelated to this PR. They fail identically if I run them in a clean repo. Still debugging that issue. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10124] Use nested map in the side input to represent contextual metadata.
body:
Use nested map in side input to represent contextual metadata to avoid building the [FileName x Offset] lookup table to support the current (Name, Offset) -> NumRecordInRange side input, yet have faster lookups for read ranges compared to the FileName -> (Offset, NumRecords) multimap representation (https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/13198). ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9980] Don't hardcode Python version in loadtests and make it switchable.
body:
Not to hardcode `python 3.7` in load test and performance test groovy files. Following tests are affected. ``` beam_LoadTests_Python_CoGBK_Flink_Batch beam_LoadTests_Python_Combine_Dataflow_Batch beam_LoadTests_Python_Combine_Dataflow_Streaming beam_LoadTests_Python_GBK_Flink_Batch beam_LoadTests_Python_GBK_Dataflow_Batch beam_LoadTests_Python_GBK_Dataflow_Streaming beam_LoadTests_Python_GBK_reiterate_Dataflow_Batch beam_LoadTests_Python_GBK_reiterate_Dataflow_Streaming beam_LoadTests_Python_ParDo_Flink_Batch beam_LoadTests_Python_ParDo_Flink_Streaming beam_LoadTests_Python_ParDo_Dataflow_Batch beam_LoadTests_Python_ParDo_Dataflow_Streming beam_Python_LoadTests_Smoke beam_LoadTests_Python_SideInput_Dataflow_Batch beam_LoadTests_Python_CoGBK_Flink_Batch beam_LoadTests_Python_CoGBK_Dataflow_Batch beam_LoadTests_Python_CoGBK_Dataflow_Streaming beam_PerformanceTests_BiqQueryIO_Read_Python beam_PerformanceTests_BiqQueryIO_Write_Python_Batch beam_PerformanceTests_PubsubIOIT_Python_Streaming ``` ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-11146] Add fasterCopy option to Flink runner
body:
The `fasterCopy` option, removes an unnecessary deep copy in the Flink runner between each operator. This should lead to improved performance in all cases. The Jira issue has more info. This is my first contribution to Beam and I just did what I thought was right. The biggest issue here was to get pipeline options into the `CoderTypeSerializer`. I tried my best, but welcome any feedback! One thing I am not quite sure how to do is test this. Should all flink tests be ran twice with this option toggled? All tests pass with the change in `CoderTypeSerializer` applied, but I've not tried all of them with the flag enabled. How would one go about this? ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Update doc/examples: BigQuerySource to ReadFromBigQuery
body:
Hi team, This is a doc only change to update the deprecated (since 2.25.0) `BigQuerySource` to the new `ReadFromBigQuery`. As this is my first contribution, I am not sure if I need to also create a JIRA ticket along with doc only changes. If needed, I can create a ticket later on. Thanks, Bin PS: I noticed that that the old API is also still used in other places in the codebase 1) integration test codes 2) example/cookbook pipelines. I wonder if I should also update those to the new API? ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11165] Use the ZetaSQL Streaming API synchronously
body:

title: [BEAM-11164] Fixes bug in beam.Partition
body:
Before this change, beam.Partition doesn't correctly pass PValue typed side inputs to the downstream ParDo transform, which causes the Beam pipeline fails if passing a Pvalue typed side input to beam.Partition ptransform. In this change, args and kwargs are rebuilt before being passed to the downstream ParDo. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: Changing BigQuery insertAll error from INFO level logging to WARNING
body:
When users are debugging beam, often times there are filters on log severity level that make it easier to look at details that threw errors. In many pipeline, BigQuery insertAll errors get missed because they are reported as INFO, and a good handful of users end up having to enable INFO level logging in order to see errors. Since BigQuery insertAll errors often times can lead to the pipeline being stuck for hours, being able to log this at the WARNING level would make this easier for debugging and monitoring. title: [BEAM-11016] Serialize AwsCredentialsProvider for AWS SDK v2 IO connectors

title: [BEAM-11160] Fix HadoopFormatIOIT
body:
beam_PerformanceTests_HadoopFormat is failing since ElasticSearch update. The problem was that there was no dependency for apache `commons-lang3` and `NoSuchMethodError: StringUtils.isNoneEmpty` was thrown. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Bump vendored Calcite version to 0.2
body:
This integrates the fix from #10559, which fixes clashes between non-vendored Calcite and vendored Calcite for ZetaSQL. The vendored Calcite artifact should be published before accepting this pull request. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-8719 BEAM-8768 BEAM-8769 BEAM-8770 BEAM-8771] Update minor hadoop dependencies
body:
This PR: - updates Hadoop dependencies from 2.8.5 to 2.10.1 - adds tests for Hadoop 2.8.5 compatibility in modules that have hadoop dependencies as 'provided' For the tests I've taken the approach that is already used in KafkaIO. I tried to add tests for Hadoop 2.7.7 but without success. I haven't verified if the problem comes from tests configuration or the IO itself but since this PR is to assure the compatibility with the previous version used in Beam (2.8.5) I'd like not to touch it. It could be worth to file a Jira to add tests for 2.7.7 version. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11070] Skip py bundle finalization test.
body:
Current py bundle finalization test is flaky on Flink since Flink checkpointing may not happen right before the pipeline finishes. We can rewrite the test to use SDF initiated checkpoint to force bundle finalization happens. But it requires https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/13105 being checked in first. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. different name in step translation phase **Please** add a meaningful description for your change here ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9547] Auto-populate any unimplemented methods/properties with not_implemented_method
body:
This PR primarily adds an `@populate_not_implemented(pandas_type)` annotation for use on our Deferred pandas types. It automatically populates any missing methods and properties with `not_implemented_method`. This has a couple of benefits: - It's more helpful for our users, directing them to BEAM-9547 - Reduces the number of failing tests, getting us closer to running this continuously - It gives us a frequency count for unimplemented methods in the user guide test: ``` 4619 total test cases: 0 skipped (0.0%) 784 NotImplementedError (17.0%) 223 NameError following NotImplementedError (28.4%) 26 'resample' is not yet supported (BEAM-9547) (3.3%) 24 'rolling' is not yet supported (BEAM-9547) (3.1%) 22 'cat' is not yet supported (BEAM-9547) (2.8%) 22 'apply' is not yet supported (BEAM-9547) (2.8%) 21 'loc' is not yet supported (BEAM-9547) (2.7%) 20 'reindex' is not yet supported (BEAM-9547) (2.6%) 19 'dt' is not yet supported (BEAM-9547) (2.4%) 17 'interpolate' is not yet supported (BEAM-9547) (2.2%) 16 'sort_index' is not yet supported (BEAM-9547) (2.0%) 16 'loc.setitem' is not yet supported (BEAM-9547) (2.0%) 15 'iloc' is not yet supported (BEAM-9547) (1.9%) 13 'mean' is not yet supported (BEAM-9547) (1.7%) 13 '__getitem__' is not yet supported (BEAM-9547) (1.7%) 12 GroupBy.agg currently only supports callable arguments (1.5%) 11 'ndim' is not yet supported (BEAM-9547) (1.4%) 11 'describe' is not yet supported (BEAM-9547) (1.4%) 11 'sample' is not yet supported (BEAM-9547) (1.4%) 9 (1.1%) 9 'duplicated' is not yet supported (BEAM-9547) (1.1%) 432 apache_beam.dataframe.frame_base.WontImplementError (9.4%) 190 NameError following apache_beam.dataframe.frame_base.WontImplementError (44.0%) 65 order-sensitive (15.0%) 35 non-deferred (8.1%) 30 non-deferred value (6.9%) 26 order sensitive (6.0%) 22 Conversion to a non-deferred a numpy array. (5.1%) 17 non-lazy (3.9%) 16 Use iloc or loc with integer slices. (3.7%) 13 iloc.setitem (3.0%) 8 non-deferred column values (1.9%) 4 deprecated (0.9%) 3 random access files (0.7%) 1 scalar value (0.2%) 1 plot (0.2%) 1 others must be None, Series, or List[Series]. List[str] is not supported. (0.2%) 1011 failed (21.9%) 2392 passed (51.8%) ``` The PR also includes a change to doctests.py to correctly distinguish between NotImplemented and WontImplement when both are allowed, as well as some minor compliance changes, in separate commits. title: Increase Dataflow V2 validates runner timeout.
body:
The suite is failing consistently with a timeout. One successful run previously completed with 1 minute to spare (269min). Bumping by an hour. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-5465] Run cleanVendor task when clean is invoked
body:
How it works: ``` ./gradlew :sdks:go:container:build ls container boot.go build build.gradle Dockerfile vendor ``` ``` ./gradlew :sdks:go:container:clean ls container boot.go build.gradle Dockerfile ``` ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-11144] Fix trigger prefetching so that the correct trigger index
body:
is used for the state namespace. Previously prefetching was fetching non-existent state, possibly adding unnecessary fetches as well as neglecting to prefetch actual state used. Another way to accomplish this would be to change the TriggerStateMachine prefetch methods to take a TriggerContext instead of a raw state accessor. This would allow for TriggerStateMachine to get the correct state for subtriggers. That seems more inline with how the nonprefetch methods work however that is a public interface change. **Please** add a meaningful description for your change here ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11166] Use a 'slim' flavor for Python images to reduce the image size.
body:
We could reduce the size of Python container images by switching to slim version of the base image. We have been building Dataflow Python containers from 'slim' versions for a while and haven't encountered any issues. A slim version shaves 750 MB of unpacked image size as per `docker images`: ``` python 3.7-slim-buster 217e85391449 8 days ago 112MB python 3.7-buster b0dee8d708b9 8 days ago 876MB ``` ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-11151] Adds the ToString well-known transform URN
body:
This adds the ToString URN to the list of well-known transforms. the ToString transform allows for Runners to translate a given element into a human-readable string. This is useful for debugging, creating tools, or features on the runner side that generalize across SDKs that require element introspection. Design-doc: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1v7iWj0LIum04mYwRM_Cvze915tATwmEzLrqj_uVBkCE/ ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier).
